experience: You and Daniel both know Mike Hawksworth, Anila Arthanari, and 167 others
How many times do colleagues become enemies?
I've had to remind myself that for some, work is just a job and for some, work is a calling.
And for others still, work is somewhere in between.
The bonds of affection must be the purpose that connects all of us to each other, acting as a tie that binds us together and reminds us of our humanity when the daily grind threatens to wear us thin.
So today, I penned this purpose statement for Launch Forth
At Launch Forth, we are in pursuit of products.
We exist to design the products of tomorrow, today.
We believe it’s worthy work to connect more people to the product development process, to empower their ideas and solutions.
We believe in and fight for greatness in the product design process.
That’s the work we do every day.

“We are not enemies, but friends. We must not be enemies. Though passion may have strained, it must not break our bonds of affection. The mystic chords of memory will swell when again touched, as surely they will be, by the better angels of our nature.”
Celebrated my 5 year anniversary at LinkedIn last week.  Here are a few quick reflections -

1) Relationships matter - Pat was a fraternity brother of mine who graduated from the same university, but *cough* some time earlier than I had .   We had never met before and I had never considered LinkedIn as a potential place to work.  All we had a few common connections and this flash-in-the-pan startup called LinkedIn brought us together.

2) Recruiting is a grueling process - It took 6 months and several coffee and lunch catch ups with Patrick before I was ready to even consider a new role.  But Pat is a pro and has the patience of a saint.  Thanks for giving me a shot Pat :)

3) Leap first and ask questions later; trust your gut - I knew absolutely nothing about LinkedIn or recruitment at the time, but I knew that I wanted to get into a SaaS sales position and move away from IT infrastructure sales.  Taking a new job or starting a new career is one of those things you'll never be 100% sure about.  Have some faith and if you're any good at what you do then you'll find a way to make it work.
To quote Billy Madison..."Man, am I glad I called that guy"...

I'm spending the day drinking up the DevOps goodness at the very impressive Galvanize facility thanks to Neil Shah and the good folks at Headfarmer, LLC. Despite my current title and responsibilities, DevOps is still my primary passion in this industry!

Y Scouts is transforming how people and companies connect to work that matters.We are a purpose-based leadership search firm. We believe that people are the only real competitive advantage in business and the best employer/employee connections start by connecting through a shared sense of purpose. It’s in the spirit of this philosophy that we engage with our clients to understand their business purpose, their values, their culture, their competitive landscape, their challenges, and most importantly, their people. Our approach to leadership search involves three distinct discovery phases: 1. Purpose Discovery2. Personality Discovery3. Professional Discovery

Culture is at the heart of everything we do at Infusionsoft—how we live, how we work and how we serve the small business community. It isn't about perks, and it doesn't exist solely to make our employees happy (although it does that, too). Infusionsoft culture is about providing a foundation to achieve our purpose: to help small businesses succeed.While at Infusionsoft, I:...was lucky enough to work on a small but scrappy Talent Acquisition team, where my responsibilities aligned to Technical roles within the Product Development and Operations organizations....was responsible for 50+ highly skilled Infusionites joining the team, specifically in – but not limited to - Senior leadership, Product Management, UI/UX Design, Software Engineering, DevOps, IT, Business Intelligence, and Data Science.  ...partnered with hiring leaders to build robust and efficient interview processes and feedback loops. This included the selection and implementation of a new and efficient platform for interviewing Software Engineers, saving ~8 hours of engineering time per hire....was the first in-house, dedicated Technical Recruiter hired at Infusionsoft and had the responsibility of shifting the culture from a dependence on staffing agencies to one of self-reliance and talent attraction, reducing spend on agencies from >$10k/m to zero over the first 4 months....mentored and trained new members of the Talent Recruitment team....had the privilege of representing Infusionsoft as a brand advocate in the community at career fairs, tech meet ups and local coding schools.Our technical environment included Greenhouse ATS, Google Docs, HackerRank, Linkedin Recruiter, Indeed, etc.

Insight Enterprises, Inc. is a leading technology provider of hardware, software and service solutions to business and government clients in North America, Europe, the Middle East, Africa and Asia-Pacific. Insight is focused on helping organizations move technology goals forward in the areas of Cloud, Virtualization, Data Center, Unified Communication & Collaboration, Networking & Security, Data Protection, Mobility & Point of Sale, and Office Productivity. With approximately 5,400 teammates worldwide, operating in 21 countries, and serving clients internationally with more than 2,300 product and industry certifications. Insight is ranked number 483 on Fortune magazine’s 2014 Fortune 500 list and generated sales of $5.5 billion at 2014 year end.I specialize in the Microsoft Services and IT Stack nationwide, specifically in Exchange, Active Directory, Lync, Systems Management (SCCM, SCOM, Service Manager, Operations Manager), Identity and Access Management, O365, SharePoint, and Dynamics CRM.Join our team! Visit our Careers page at jobs.insight.com

Who We Are: A family-oriented, generous, community based company which offers sustainable, profitable, challenging, and fun employment opportunities for our people AND fosters deep long term partnerships with our clients. To be viewed by our customers as a trusted advisor and the leading provider of high-caliber Microsoft solutions. What We Do: Business Meets Technology. Statera is a business and technology services and solutions provider that helps companies large and small optimize organizational performance by mapping strategic goals and objectives to IT initiatives Our expertise is solving today’s unique business challenges with innovative technology solutions which include: enterprise .NET application development, SharePoint customization and implementation, CRM solutions, Advanced Infrastructure Services, SQL Database Development and Business Intelligence (BI), and Enterprise Project Management as well as Business Process Solutions. Every solution we develop begins with taking the time to discover and define the needs, challenges and goals of each of our customers. http://www.statera.com/careers/

Business & Decision is an international Consulting and Systems Integration (CSI) company. We are a leader in Business Intelligence (BI), Enterprise Performance Management (EPM), Data Warehousing, Master Data Management (MDM), Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), and are a major player in Life Sciences Computer Systems Validation (CSV).Founded in 1992 and listed on the Euronext, the group has gained its leadership by leveraging its functional and technological expertise to successfully address your organization's most critical challenges. Located in 19 countries, Business & Decision currently employs more than 2600 people worldwide.

The MSD is a research degree in design; it is not a mere extension of the undergraduate studio experience found in many master’s degrees in design. Consequently, it offers a different professional path, one meant for design students who wish to pursue an investigative career in design leading to discovery and development of intellectual capital. More than that, it is about what you want to do, not want you want to be.The Healthcare and Healing Environments concentration provides students with the opportunity to examine factors impacting the design, planning and evaluation of healthcare facilities and healing environments using design research tools. Students in this concentration are mentored by local healthcare design practitioners as they team with nursing students, work for actual clients and correspond with forward-thinking healthcare research centers.
